briefTitle: Trial Evaluating Efficacy and Safety of Dasiglucagon in Children With Congenital Hyperinsulinism

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* CHI diagnosis established based on the following:

  1. Hyperinsulinemia: plasma insulin above the limit of detection of the assay documented during an event of hypoglycemia, and/or
  2. Hypofattyacidemia: plasma free fatty acid \<1.7 mmol/L, and/or
  3. Hypoketonemia: Beta-hydroxybutyrate \<1.8 mmol/L, and/or
  4. Glycemic response: an increase in plasma glucose (PG) of \>30 mg/dL (1.7 mmol/L) after 1 mg IV or intramuscular (IM) glucagon administration
* Male or female, age ≥7 days and \<12 months at screening
* Body weight of ≥2.0 kg (4.4 lbs.)
* Continuous IV glucose requirement to prevent hypoglycemia

Exclusion Criteria:

* Is suspected of having a transient form of CHI (e.g., transient hyperinsulinism due to maternal diabetes or perinatal stress)
* Was born preterm below 34 weeks of gestational age
* Presence of hypertension or hypotension, including circulatory instability requiring supportive medication or presence of pheochromocytoma
* Known or suspected presence of severe brain damage
* Evidence of metabolic, endocrine, or syndromic causes of hypoglycemia not due to hyperinsulinism
* Use of systemic corticosteroids, e.g., hydrocortisone \>20 mg/m\^2 body surface area or equivalent within 5 days before screening
* Prior use of lanreotide, sirolimus (mechanistic target of rapamycin \[mTOR\] inhibitors), anti-inflammatory biological agents, or other immune modulating agents. Prior use of octreotide is allowed after a minimum of 48 hour washout before randomization.
* Any clinically significant abnormality identified on echocardiogram that in the opinion of the investigator would affect the subject's ability to participate in the trial
* Any recognized clotting or bleeding disorder
* The use of prescription or non-prescription medications known to cause QT prolongation

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Intravenous Glucose Infusion Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean intravenous (IV) glucose infusion rate (GIR) in the last 12 hours of each treatment period during Part 1, the crossover part of the trial (dasiglucagon or placebo administration).

outcomeMeasures.title: Carbohydrates Administered
outcomeMeasures.description: Total amount (g) of carbohydrates administered during the crossover part of the trial (dasiglucagon or placebo administration) per day.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Intravenous Glucose Infusion Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean IV GIR for each 48-hour treatment period during Part 1, the crossover part of the trial (dasiglucagon or placebo administration).

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Intravenous Glucose Infusion Rate Below 10 mg/kg/Minute
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean IV GIR below 10 mg/kg/minute in the last 12 hours of each treatment period during Part 1, the crossover part of the trial (dasiglucagon or placebo administration) (yes/no)

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Complete Weaning Off Intravenous Glucose
outcomeMeasures.description: Time in days to complete weaning off IV glucose administration during Part 2, defined as the first point in time when the patient had been off IV glucose administration for at least 12 hours.

outcomeMeasures.title: Hypoglycemia Event Rate in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Hypoglycemia event rate, defined as number of hypoglycemic events when PG was \<70 mg/dL (or 3.9 mmol/L), as detected by self-monitored plasma glucose.

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinically Significant Hypoglycemia Events in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Clinically significant hypoglycemia event rate, defined as number of events when PG was \<54 mg/dL (3.0 mmol/L), as detected by self-monitored plasma glucose.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Actual Hospital Discharge
outcomeMeasures.description: Time in days to actual hospital discharge defined as the time from first exposure to the study drug in Part 2 to discharge from hospital.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Pancreatic Surgery
outcomeMeasures.description: Time (days) to pancreatic surgery (sub-total or total pancreatectomy with a cutoff of ≥95%).

outcomeMeasures.title: Carbohydrates Administered
outcomeMeasures.description: Total amount (g) of carbohydrates administered (regardless of the route) per day.

outcomeMeasures.title: Carbohydrates Administered Intravenously
outcomeMeasures.description: Amount (g) of carbohydrates administered via IV glucose infusion or bolus or total parenteral nutrition. This secondary endpoint was intended to account only for carbohydrates administered via IV glucose infusion or bolus. It was not possible to differentiate between carbohydrates administered via IV glucose infusion or bolus and carbohydrates administered as being, or not being, part of total parenteral nutrition from the collected data. This endpoint was expanded to include both.

outcomeMeasures.title: Carbohydrates Administered Parenterally
outcomeMeasures.description: Amount (g) of carbohydrates administered as part of total parenteral nutrition.

outcomeMeasures.title: Carbohydrates Administered Orally
outcomeMeasures.description: Amount (g) of carbohydrates administered via oral route.

outcomeMeasures.title: Carbohydrates Administered Via Gastric Feed
outcomeMeasures.description: Amount (g) of carbohydrates administered via nasogastric tube or gastrostomy.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time in Range in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent time in range (PG between 70 to 180 mg/dL \[3.9-10.0 mmol/L\]) as measured by continuous glucose monitoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time in Hypoglycemia in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent time in hypoglycemia (when PG was \<70 mg/dL \[or 3.9 mmol/L\]) as measured by continuous glucose monitoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time in Clinically Significant Hypoglycemia in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent time in clinically significant hypoglycemia (when PG was \<54 mg/dL \[or 3.0 mmol/L\]) as measured by continuous glucose monitoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Hypoglycemia Episodes in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Rate of hypoglycemia episodes, defined as number of episodes per week when PG was \<70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L) for 15 minutes or more, as measured by continuous glucose monitoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinically Significant Hypoglycemia Episodes in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Rate of clinically significant hypoglycemia episodes, defined as number of episodes per week when was \<54 mg/dL (3.0 mmol/L) for 15 minutes or more, as measured by continuous glucose monitoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Extent of Hypoglycemia in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Extent of hypoglycemia (defined as the area over the glucose curve \[AOCglucose\] below 70 mg/dL \[3.9 mmol/L\]) as measured by continuous glucose monitoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Extent of Clinically Significant Hypoglycemia in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Extent of clinically significant hypoglycemia (defined as the area over the glucose curve \[AOCglucose\] below 54 mg/dL \[3.0 mmol/L\]) as measured by continuous glucose monitoring, divided by the total duration in hours of continuous glucose monitoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time in Hyperglycemia in Part 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent time in hyperglycemia (when PG was \>180 mg/dL \[10.0 mmol/L\]), as measured by continuous glucose monitoring.
